results.title: Georges Rouault (1871-1958)
results.creator_credit: Texture Films, Isabelle Rouault, Pierre Courthion and Genevieve Nouaille Rouault
results.brief_description: A film on the twentieth century master painter Georges Rouault, his childhood, the atelier of Gustave Moreau, the scandalous Fauves, violent social protest, the Miserere and the last glowing Biblical Landscapes.

results.title: Georges Melies
results.brief_description:
A survey of the life and work of film pioneer Georges Melies covering his work as a graphic artist, magician, theatre entrepreneur, filmmaker and actor. Illustrated by graphics, stills, and one clip from his films.

Credits: Director, Claude Leroy.

results.title: George Washington country
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, Frost Productions and Edmund Frost
results.brief_description: George Washington was born in the area shown in this film in 1732. Scenic and historical spots of central eastern United States included are Mt. Vernon, Philadelphia, Washington DC. and Colonial Williamsburg. George Washington became the first American hero through his character and deeds in this area during the Revolutionary War.

results.title: George Washington - his life and times: conquering the wilderness
results.brief_description: Part of a silent series called “George Washington: his life and times” this historic re-enactment is interspersed with titles explaining each segment. This episode focuses on Washington in his younger years including his school years. Tells of the influence Lord Fairfax had on Washington, and describes the occupation of the east coast by the British and Washington’s endeavour to drive the French out of Ohio to the west. Concludes with an oration read by Washington at the funeral of General Braddock.

results.title: George Washington
results.creator_credit: Youandwhatarmy Filmed Challenges, Blue Moon Prod, Code Red, Down Home Entertainment, David Gordon Green, Sarah Mueller, Lisa Muskat, Erin Aldridge and R. Craig Zobel
results.brief_description: A first feature by director David Gordon Green, this is a sensitively observed drama about young adolescents in a poor rural North Carolina town. The loose narrative centres around the attempts of the thirteen year old George Washington (Donald Holden) to make the twelve year old Nassia (Candace Evanofski) fall in love with him. Gradually, through watching the youths interact with each other, with their families and with the townspeople, the film creates a distinct emotional and social milieu. Though its details and observances are realist, the richly evocative cinematography and Gordon’s intimate direction creates a poetry of the everyday. When an accident strikes the group of youngsters, the film takes on a tragic power. But unlike Hollywood corporate work, in “George Washington” there are no easy resolutions or simplistic judgements. This is a truly independent and personal film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Youandwhatarmy Filmed Challenges, Blue Moon Prod, Code Red, Down Home Entertainment, David Gordon Green, Sarah Mueller, Lisa Muskat, Erin Aldridge and R. Craig Zobel

results.title: George Segal
results.brief_description: This film looks at the life and works of the American sculptor George Segal who invented his own personal style of sculpture: white plaster figures that silently prevail in their own environments, which have been influenced by American townships. The figures are cast from live models, Segal’s family and friends. Shows Segal at work and the controversy aroused by his commisioned piece for Kent University.
